books.title: Short Plays
books.author: J. M. Synge
books.summary: A collection of three short plays by J. M. Synge.

books.title: Tarzan of the Apes
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An orphan is raised by apes in Africa and goes on various adventures.

books.title: You Can’t Win
books.author: Jack Black
books.summary: Jack Black’s autobiographical account of life “on the road” as a professional thief and hobo during the late 19th century and early 20th century.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Swiss Family Robinson
books.author: Johann David Wyss
books.summary: A Swiss family is shipwrecked on a remote island in the East Indies.

books.title: Ukridge Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of stories featuring P. G. Wodehouse’s charismatic character Stanley Featherstonehaugh Ukridge.

books.title: Henry V
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Shakespeare’s 1599 play chronicling the history of King Henry the Fifth and his famous victory over the French at the Battle of Agincourt.

books.title: Master Flea
books.author: E. T. A. Hoffmann
books.summary: A gentleman bachelor gains an epic advantage of tiny proportions in this allegorical, Romantic, fairy-tale novel.

books.title: The Adventures of Captain Hatteras
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A mysterious captain assembles a ship and crew for a secret and dangerous voyage.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.

books.title: The Talleyrand Maxim
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: The estate of a deceased magnate falls prey to an unscrupulous administrator.

books.title: A Journal of the Plague Year
books.author: Daniel Defoe
books.summary: An account of one man’s survival in London during the Great Plague of 1665.

books.title: Walden
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: Thoreau’s report on his social experiment of solitude, simplicity, and self-reliance.

books.title: Idylls of the King
books.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson
books.summary: Twelve poems detailing the adventures of Arthur’s round table.

books.title: Where Angels Fear to Tread
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: After an English widow on holiday impetuously falls in love with a handsome young Tuscan, her panicked in-laws send a rescue party.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Lais
books.author: Marie de France
books.summary: A collection of twelfth-century medieval tales of chivalry and romance.

books.title: Festus
books.author: Philip James Bailey
books.summary: A man goes on a quest for knowledge, truth, and understanding in the face of the complexities of existence and spirituality.

books.title: Two Years Before the Mast
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A Harvard student embarks on a two-year voyage as a sailor aboard a merchant ship, exposing the harsh conditions of life at sea in the 19th century.
